channel.title: Science News - Times of India
channel.description: Latest news, top updates and current developments from the world of Health, Science and technology along with tips on physical & mental health and fitness.

item.title: Viper venom clue in Alzheimer's fight
item.description: Lab tests have shown that a component in the highly toxic venom prevents the deposition of proteins in a particular part of the brain that triggers Alzheimer's, say the researchers.Animal tests will begin shortly.

item.title: Humans can detect 1 trillion smells
item.description: The 10,000 odours smelling capacity was estimated back in the 1920s without any data and it has bothered scientists like Vosshall.

item.title: Hunt for habitable planets from 2024
item.description: A massive search for habitable planets orbiting alien stars will be launched in 2024.

item.title: Cambridge University scientists develop diagnostic app
item.description: In what could be a great boon for countries like India, scientists from the Cambridge University have developed a mobile phone application that can accurately measure colour-based or colorimetric tests for use in home, clinical or remote settings.

item.title: Nasa finds ‘zebra stripes’ in Earth's radiation belt
item.description: Earth’s inner radiation belt displays a persistent zebra striped pattern generated by our planet's rotation, Nasa’s twin Van Allen Probes spacecraft have found.

item.title: 'Chicken from hell': Bird-like dinosaur discovered
item.description: A 12 feet long, 500 pound sharp clawed dinosaur – a killing machine dubbed as “chicken from hell” have been found by scientists to have roamed the earth along with Tyrannosaurus Rex around 66 million years ago.

item.title: 12 feet long, 500 pound sharp clawed dinosaur discovered
item.description: A 12 feet long, 500 pound sharp clawed dinosaur – a killing machine dubbed as “chicken from hell” have been found by scientists to have roamed the earth along with Tyrannosaurus Rex around 66 million years ago.

item.title: 'Chicken from hell' sheds new light on bird-like dino
item.description: Nicknamed the "chicken from hell," a newly identified species of feathered dinosaur as tall as a human roamed North America at least 66 million years ago, paleontologists announced Wednesday.

item.title: Engineered tissue closely mimics natural heart muscle that beats
item.description: Heart muscles that actually beat, created artificially in the lab, have for the first time become a reality.

item.title: Eat less and live long, says study
item.description: A study by an evolutionary biologist has found that eating less can boost healthier ageing thereby increasing lifespan by protecting the body’s cells from harmful deterioration and cancer.

item.title: Saturated fat does not cause heart disease: Study
item.description: A dollop of ghee or butter in your diet does not cause as much harm to your heart as it was believed till now.

item.title: Humans may have two distinct cognitive systems
item.description: Scientists have found the strongest evidence yet that humans have separate and distinct cognitive systems with which they can categorize, classify and conceptualize their world.

item.title: New sports doping test '1,000 times more sensitive'
item.description: Now, for the first time, researchers on Tuesday unveiled a new weapon - a test for doping compounds that is a 1,000 times more sensitive than those used today.

item.title: Eat less, live long, scientists confirm
item.description: Scientists have developed a new evolutionary theory on why consuming a diet that is very low in nutrients extends lifespan in laboratory animals — research that could hold clues to promoting healthier ageing in humans.

item.title: Scientists create world's first 3D printed beating heart muscles and tissues
item.description: Heart muscles that actually beat, created artificially in the lab, have for the first time become a reality.

item.title: Unique GPS system onboard airplanes to precisely monitor bad weather
item.description: GPS on-board airplanes will now help detect precise conditions in the atmosphere and better predict weather conditions and improve hurricane forecasting across the globe.

item.title: Earth dodged a massive magnetic eruption from Sun that could have wreaked havoc
item.description: Earth dodged a massive magnetic eruption from the Sun in 2012 that could have wreaked havoc with the electrical grid, disabling satellites and GPS had it come nine days earlier, scientists say.

item.title: Earth dodged a massive magnetic eruption from Sun that could have wreaked havoc
item.description: A massive magnetic storm at a speed of 3,000 kilometres per second – enough to circle the Earth five times in one minute - the likes of which has not been seen in the past 150 years — almost hit earth in 2012.

item.title: Solar super storm almost hit earth in 2012
item.description: A massive magnetic storm at a speed of 3,000 kilometres per second – enough to circle the Earth five times in one minute - the likes of which has not been seen in the past 150 years — almost hit earth in 2012.

item.title: Why dark chocolate is good for you
item.description: Researchers have finally found that bacteria in the human stomach gobble dark chocolate and ferment it into anti-inflammatory compounds that are good for the heart.

item.title: Why dark chocolate is good for you
item.description: Researchers have finally found that bacteria in the human stomach gobble dark chocolate and ferment it into anti-inflammatory compounds that are good for the heart.

item.title: Lack of sleep causes loss of brain cells: Study
item.description: A new study has shown disturbing evidence that chronic sleep loss causes irreversible physical damage to and loss of brain cells.

item.title: Pet dog carries your body odour in brain
item.description: You love it when your pet dog jumps on you and licks you when you come home from office.

item.title: Women half as likely as men to study science: Survey
item.description: “Parity is still far from being reached,” said the report by The Boston Consulting Group, blaming the disparity on pervasive “stereotypes” about the sector.

item.title: Cholesterol drug may help multiple sclerosis sufferers: Report
item.description: A cheap drug used to control blood cholesterol may also slow progression of later-stage multiple sclerosis (MS), according to a study published in The Lancet on Wednesday.
